entries.title: Orsted to File Additional Legal Challenge to Trump’s Offshore Wind Halt
President Trump said Venezuela’s interim authorities will give the U.S. between 30 million and 50 million barrels of sanctioned oil, with proceeds overseen by the White House
Standing between President Trump and his vision for a stable, U.S.-friendly oil power looms one man: Diosdado Cabello
Lockheed Martin committed to surging its Patriot missile output to roughly 2,000 interceptors a year in response
The White House said the real crime on Jan. 6, 2021 was the certification of Joe Biden’s win over President Trump, not the actions of the pro-Trump mob that stormed the U.S. Capitol

Secretary of State Rubio told lawmakers that recent administration threats against Greenland didn’t signal an imminent invasion and that the goal is to buy the island from Denmark, according to people familiar with the discussions

Trump’s insistence that the U.S. should take control of Greenland was met with disbelief and dismay on Capitol Hill, with some Republicans warning that a seizure of the island was too dangerous to even contemplate
Republican Rep. Doug LaMalfa, who represented a district in Northern California for 13 years, has died. His death narrows the GOP’s slim majority.
Democrats’ appetite for another shutdown looks diminished in the wake of the 43-day government-funding lapse, driven by centrists who worry that too much damage was inflicted on American households
In the wake of the Trump administration cutting child-care funds to Minnesota, it has expanded its social-services funding freeze to include California, Colorado, Illinois and New York
ICE is sending federal immigration officers and agents to Minnesota amid a growing welfare fraud scandal
Walz Drops Re-Elect Bid As ‘24 Democrats Continue to Fade. Read more in today’s WSJ Politics newsletter:

Secretary of State Marco Rubio was there with President Trump during the press conference on the Venezuela incursion and is front and center on the issue. Read more in today’s WSJ Politics newsletter.
There are 35 Senate seats up for election in 2026, including two special elections. Democrats enter the midterm campaigns hoping history is on their side, but confronting a Senate map that is not.
Gov. JB Pritzker is backing his lieutenant governor in a Democratic face-off, but she has struggled to outshine two top rivals
A crop of moderate Democrats, including Sens. Mark Kelly and Ruben Gallego of Arizona, are trying to counter President Trump and progressive influence in their own party
Ahead of the U.S. incursion into Venezuela on Saturday, the CIA had concluded that Maduro loyalists were better placed to lead the country than the opposition was
A flurry of recent military moves underscores President Trump’s reliance on the surprise use of force
President Trump and top advisers had for months telegraphed plans to take down Nicolás Maduro. And yet, when it happened, Washington and Caracas were stunned by the attack’s ferocity and speed.
An 18-year-old Burger King worker intended to commit a terrorist attack with knives and hammers at a grocery store or fast-food restaurant in a Charlotte, N.C., suburb on New Year’s Eve, the FBI said

U.S. national-security officials say Ukraine didn’t target Vladimir Putin or one of his residences in an alleged drone operation, challenging Moscow’s assertion that Kyiv sought to kill the Russian president
